messages.subject: RE: [UnschoolingDiscussion] reading kids' minds.
messages.msgSnippet: Great story.  When we start getting into a I thought you knew I always tell them I cannot read their minds. I tell my girls... keep me informed of what your
messages.messageBody:
Great story. When we start getting into a "I thought you knew" I always
tell them I cannot read their minds. I tell my girls..."keep me informed of
what your plans are, you don't really want me to try to read you minds, do
you?!" The answer is always a resounding NO!



~April
Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-10.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
<http://www.reachhomeschool.com> www.reachhomeschool.com

* Michigan Unschoolers
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/>
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/
*Check out Chuck's art! <http://www.artkunst23.com/>
http://www.artkunst23.com
*Michigan Youth Theater...Acting On Our Dreams...
<http://www.michiganyouththeater.com/> http://www.michiganyouththeater.com
"Know where to find the information and how to use it - That's the secret of
success."
Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

_____

From: UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
SandraDodd@...
Sent: Monday, August 29, 2005 2:59 PM
To: unschoolingdiscussion@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [UnschoolingDiscussion] reading kids' minds. <g>



The words of Holly Dodd:

"The information you don't have, you just have to know that you don't know
it, that's all.

"But it would be better if you could read our minds."


That was about me complaining that Marty expected me to know his day's plan
this morning, because he had told Holly last night. And a week ago, he and

Holly talked in the middle of the night, and Holly expected me to know the
next
morning.

I teased her just now, saying there was paper by the door, and a pencil, and

they could write and I could read, so maybe they shouldn't expect me to just

KNOW what they discuss at 2:00 in the morning. "I'm working with
insufficient
information," I said. And I got ""The information you don't have, you
just
have to know that you don't know it. . . "

Sandra


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
